runs.comm: pitched up outside off, stroked to cover. Tamim wants a quick single and gets it easily
darted into the pads, Soumya slogs and may have got a tickle onto it, as the umpire suggests
tossed up, nudged to square leg
heading down the leg side, Tamim just helps it on its way with a neat sweep
full on middle, defended back to the bowler
Tamim uses his feet, Wellington drops it shorter. Worked to midwicket
slipping down leg, diverted towards short fine leg off the pad
angled in, Soumya plays across the line and takes it on the front thigh
short of a length and outside off, Soumya dabs a cut to third man
back of a length and angled onto the thigh, Tamim leans across and misses the sweep
length ball on a fourth-stump line, Tamim bends forward and pats it to point
Tamim dances out in a bid to drill this one down the ground. He mistimes it as the ball only rolls to mid-on
short on middle, cut away to cover
Tamim charges down the track, Raza pulls his length back. Swatted down to long-on
slides on outside off, leans back and cuts it firmly past backward point
down the track, takes it on the full and hits it to mid-off
Raza gives this loads of air, Tamim steps out, slogs and misses. The keeper is beaten as well, squandering a stumping chance
Raza digs it short, sat up to be smacked. Pulled strongly over midwicket
full and outside off, Soumya pounces on it, he sends it skimming over long-off
dipping full toss, swung away behind square. Soumya slips as he turns around for the second. He is on the floor

another poor mix-up in the match. Short and down leg, Tamim helps it towards short fine leg, where Wellington dives to his left and makes a smart save. Soumya keeps running, Tamim keeps watching the ball. Both batsmen find themselves at the keeper's end. Soumya is run out for 7 on return
back of a length on middle, Tamim misses his leg-side jab. The umpire suggests he may have got an edge there
length on off, defended to cover
back of a length and on off, coaxed to mid-on with the wrists for one
full and slanting away with the angle, dinked to third man
straight in line, Tamim leans forward and flicks to midwicket region
width outside off, Sabbir frees his arms as he crunches a drive through the covers
short, lifting ball on off, fended back to Vitori
dug in short and hurries onto Sabbir, he looks to pull. Instead, he flaps it in front of mid-on
off-side wide, wild ball
short and outside off, slapped to cover
full on middle, turned behind square on the leg side for a couple
back of a length and on off, twirled to square leg
back of a length on middle, Tamim waits for the ball to arrive and dabs a cut fine of short third man
short and down leg, deflected behind to Moor off the thigh
short on the leg stump. Pulled away to deep square leg
Jongwe drifts a slower ball down the leg side
full and wide outside off, crashed in the gap at cover for four. Ouch, the wide hurts Zim. Sabbir punches gloves with Tamim
flighted, tickled off the pads to square leg
slides on outside off, chopped past cover
knocked to long-on from off stump

Cremer strikes in his first over. He inspects the toe end of his bat as he trudges back. Tossed up nicely, Tamim charges down the track and looks to lift it over long-off. He skewers it, two men converge on the ball. Sibanda runs in from long-off and eventually snaffles it
flat legbreak outside off, back-foot punch to long-off
worked in front of square. Vitori keeps it to one
drifts in on middle, picked away through midwicket
full and aimed at off, clipped to the same fielder
Sabbir comes down the pitch and is rapped on the pad. He gets across for a leg bye
dropped short and outside off, chopped to point
skiddy ball on middle, clipped through midwicket
Sabbir taps a flighted ball on off to cover and sets off for a quick single. Chigumbura's throw isn't great
lovely loop on middle, poked to leg for one
short ball on middle, Hom skips back and pulls to deep backward square leg
flighted and outside off, carved past cover. Sweeper tidies up in the deep
shortish legbreak outside off, cracked to sweeper cover again
quickish length ball, defended
down the track, slogged to cow corner off the inside half
slides in on middle, Hom skips out and whips a couple to long-on

Hom bowled? Or did the keeper knock the bails off? Hom is gone. This one grips in the surface and turns enough to beat Hom's attempted dab and clip the top of the off stump. The bails come off, rather belatedly just before Moor was shaping to stump Hom
full and outside off, eased into the gap at cover
run down to short third man from outside off
drifts in on off, too full, squeezed back to Williams
Mushfiq shuffles outside leg, dances down the pitch and displays an inside-out drive past cover
darted short on off, comes in. The googly is parcelled up and dispatched over midwicket with a pull
Sabbir skips out and quietly takes it on the pad

top, top ball. Cremer lands this just a shade outside off and gets it to rip further away, leaving the batsman prodding and missing. Moor, the keeper, was so confident that the batsman edged it, so much so he did not bother to effect the stumping
shortish and outside off, cut away past the covers
length ball, played to the off side
squirted towards square leg off an inside edge
arm-ball, snakes in, blocked back
reverse-paddled to short third man
round-armish full ball, knocked to the midwicket region
low full toss on middle, Mushfiq connects with a reverse-sweep and hits it over backward point
drifting onto the pads, tickled in front of midwicket
Dropped at long-on! Sabbir uses his feet and swings it towards long-on. Sibanda runs in and spills a sitter
flicked past midwicket
chopped towards point
tossed up on middle, Mushfiq nips down the track, makes room and laces it inside out over the covers

quicker full ball, dabbed towards midwicket. The pair set off for a quick single. Wellington rushes after the ball and nails the stumps down at his end. The bat bounces up in the air... Replays, though, show the bat was grounded by the time the bails were dislodged. The dive saves Mushfiq
Sabbir steps out and slogs a single to deep midwicket
Mushfiq goes low and slog-sweeps it behind square on the leg side
Mushfiq steps away outside leg, manufactures swinging room and flays it over cover
drifts in and turns, poked in front of short third man off a leading edge
tucked off the pads behind square
touch short, swatted to long-on from outside off
fired quicker on middle and leg, reverse-sweep and a miss
knocked to the vacant midwicket region
hurrying ball, inside-edged to short fine leg
flighted on middle, Sabbir dances out and clobbers it over cow corner
full and outside off, Sabbir goes for an encore. He fails. Sabbir gets low and slogs. The ball drops into the hands of Waller at deep midwicket
chipped into the midwicket area for one
flighted and outside off, Shakib dabs it to third man off an outside edge
much slower through the air. Blocked
chopped from off stump to backward point
tossed up on middle, patted in front of point
Mushfiq attempts an ambitious reverse-sweep and misses. He is hit on the arm
cut from the stumps, this time by Shakib
Crucial wicket, Zimbabwe stay in the contest! Full and just a shade outside off, Mushfiq goes low for his pet shot - the slog sweep - and ends up skying it to deep midwicket. Raza is pumped
nudged off the pads to short fine leg
back of a length and on middle, Shakib uses his wrists and plays it in front of mid-on
length and outside off, guided to third man
Shakib makes room, waits for the slower ball, adjusts, and cuts it towards deep cover. They take the third off an overthrow
short and width outside off, Mahmudullah makes room and cuts it. He sends it flying over the covers
six and out! The off stump is knocked back. Near-yorker length ball, Mahmudullah loses his shape and bottom-edges the ball back to disturb the furniture
Nurul walks down the track, this short ball is floated outside off to beat the new batsman
yorker, right at the base of middle, Shakib angles it to short third man
full on middle again, squeezed to midwicket
Shakib jumps outside leg, Vitori chases him. Driven to long-on
full on off, Nurul drops to one knee, scoops it fine of short fine leg
pretty full and on off, flashed into the covers
Shakib steps out, makes room. Vitori gets the yorker wrong and sprays miles down leg, beating the diving Moor
full on middle and leg, whipped to long leg
Shakib steps away outside leg, Jongwe fires a yorker, and pings the pad
slower ball on off, nudged towards mid-on
short of a length on middle, Shakib backs away and carves it over to the third man boundary
Shakib backs away again, the bowler follows him with a full toss. Whirl of the wrists as Shakib whips over backward square leg

Bangladesh open 2016 with a four-wicket win! That's the hosts' second-highest successful run chase in T20s. Shakib backs away and throws the bowler off course again. Jongwe slings a wide ball down leg. The dive from Moor is not enough again
